results.title: Austin Powers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jay Roach, Demi Moore, Jennifer Todd, Mike Myers, Suzanne Todd and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Comedian Mike Myers (Wayne’s World) takes on the dual role of sixties super spy, renowned fashion photographer and insatiable casanova Austin Powers and his arch-enemy Dr Evil in this colourful parody of the James Bond films. Starting off in swinging London of the sixties, the film quickly moves into the present when Austin Powers must travel across time to stop Dr. Evil’s world conquering exploits, who has cryogenically frozen himself (and his cat Mr. Bigglesworth) and resurfaced in the nineties. Much of the films fish out of water humour is based on the difficulty Austin has in adjusting to a modern world that has little tolerance for a promiscuous, sexist, British secret agent with bad teeth and Dr Evil’s thwarted plans to outsmart a society that is far more advanced in notions of evil. Cast also includes Mimi Rogers, Elizabeth Hurley, Michael York and Robert Wagner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jay Roach, Demi Moore, Jennifer Todd, Mike Myers, Suzanne Todd and New Line Cinema

results.title: Adventures of Jimmy
results.brief_description: A picturesque account of the search of a particularly naive young man for his ideal mate in the big city (San Francisco) and his rather overwhelming success at the film’s conclusion. Though told with tongue in cheek, it has a lot to say about loneliness in a busy world. Stylistically, “Adventures of Jimmy” takes a not undeserved poke at those psychoanalytical literary travelogues so popular in the 1950’s featuring the neurotic as hero. Mr Broughton reads the commentary while Weldon Kees, himself a poet and painter, arranged and plays the musical accompaniment. Written by James Broughton. Photography by Frank Stauffacher.

results.title: Adventures of Dollie
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Kidnapped from her family’s yard by a vengeful gypsy, Dolly is placed in a barrel which travels down a stream and over a waterfall. A young angler fishes the barrel from the river, and the family is reunited. Cast includes Arthur Johnson, Linda Arvidson, Charles Inslee, Madeline West. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: 23 Skidoo
results.brief_description: If you erase the people of downtown America, the effect is bizarre, not to say disturbing. That is what this film does. It shows the familiar urban scene without a soul in sight; streets empty, buildings empty, yet everywhere there is evidence of recent life and activity. At the end of the film we learn what has happened. Awards: London; Cracow; Salerno.

results.title: Good cleaning fun: housework down the years

results.title: Science needs girls too
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: A program featuring Leonie Gianetto, Ursula Groves and Ann Osman from the McClintock Collective and students from Swinburne Community School and Swinburne Technical School who examine ways in which girls can be encouraged to take a more active part in the sciences.

results.title: Sexual harassment in schools
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program looks at some examples of sexual harassment in a school setting. Focuses on the consequences of harassing behaviour and avenues available to people who wish to take action to prevent it continuing. Ways of dealing with such incidences are suggested and legal rights under the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 are explained.

results.title: Waltzing Matilda: touring Australia
results.brief_description: A tourist promotion that intermingles aspects of Australian history and culture with holiday promotion. Narrated by Charles Tingwell with original music by Bruce Smeaton. The song “Walzing Matilda” played by the Bushwackers Band is used as a theme.
